item.name: Actual power supply entire mode
item.description: Actual power supply entire mode.

item.name: Average power
item.description: System average power, unit is W.

item.name: Configuration error info
item.description: Query the error information of exporting/importing all configuration of BMC , BIOS and RAID Controller. Query the error information of uploading configuration file to remote host or download configuration file from remote host. If error happened, configerrorinfo value shows the error information. If error don't happened, configerrorinfo value is null.

item.name: CPU entire status
item.description: Information about all cpu health status.

item.name: CSR status
item.description: The status of generating CSR. CSR generation has not started or has successfully completed(1) A CSR is being generated (2) A CSR fails to be generated (3).

item.name: Device location info
item.description: The deviceLocationInfo between 0 and 64 characters. Default value is server room.

item.name: Device name
item.description: The device name value between 1 to 63 characters.

item.name: Device owner ID
item.description: The device owner ID, maxlength is 64 characters

item.name: Device serial number
item.description: The device serial number value between 1 to 63 characters.

item.name: Devices slot ID
item.description: The device slot ID of a server exists, the value ranges from 1 to 80. Otherwise, the value is 0.

item.name: ETH MAC address
item.description: Information about MAC address.

item.name: Fan entire status
item.description: Information about all fan health status.

item.name: Hard disk entire status
item.description: Information about all hard disk health status.

item.name: Host name
item.description: The host name between 1 to 64 characters. Supported characters: 0-9 a-z A-Z - ('-' is not allowed to be the first/last character). Default value is huawei.

item.name: System disk portition usage threshold
item.description: Percent of hard disk partition usage threshold. This value is in [0,100].

item.name: Local LVM state
item.description: Local KVM display state. disable 1, enable 2. Default value is enable(2).

item.name: Memory entire status
item.description: Information about all memory health status.

item.name: PCle device entire status
item.description: Information about all standard PCIe device health status.

item.name: Peak power
item.description: System peak power, unit is W.

item.name: Power capping enable
item.description: Power capping status. disable 1, enable 2. Default value is disable(1).

item.name: Power consumption
item.description: Power consume from power statistic start time, unit is kWh.

item.name: Power on control
item.description: The powerOnControl format: IP,PORT,ENABLE(eg 192.168.1.1,6999,1), maxlength is 255 characters.

item.name: Power on polici
item.description: 1 - Stay Off 2 - Restore Previous State 3 - Turn On Default value is turnon(3).

item.name: Power supply entire status
item.description: Information about all power supply health status.

item.name: Presense
item.description: Presence of security module.

item.name: Present system power
item.description: Display the present system power.

item.name: Safe poweroff time
item.description: The system safe poweroff time, the value 0 indicates non-timeout.

item.name: Setted power supply entire mode
item.description: Setted power supply entire mode. Power supply entire mode get: 1:loadBalance(1) 2:activeBackup(2) 3:unsupport(3) Power supply entire mode set: 1:loadBalance(1) 2:activeBackup(2)

item.name: Syslog enable
item.description: The enable state of syslog. Default value is disable(1).

item.name: Syslog Identity
item.description: Choose the server Identity when sending syslog.

item.name: Syslog protocol type
item.description: The syslog protocol type. Default value is TCP. udp:When receiving messages using the UDP protocol. tcp:When receiving messages using the TCP protocol. tls:When receiving messages using the TCP protocol

item.name: Syslog severity
item.description: The level of syslog send. Default level is ok. ok:send all level message. minor:send minor and above level message. major:send major and above level message. critical:send critical level message. none:send nothing.

item.name: System boot sequence
item.description: Decide the system's first boot device. 1 - No override 2 - Force PXE 3 - Force boot from default Hard-drive 4 - Force boot from default CD/DVD 5 - Force boot from Floppy/primary removable media 6 - boot flags valid. The bit should be set to indicate that valid flag data is present. This bit may be automatically cleared based on the boot flag valid bit clearing parameter, above.(This option is read-only.) 7 - Force boot into BIOS SETUP The default value is 6 (unspecified)

item.name: System CPU usage
item.description: Percent of CPU usage. The value defined as: -1: invalid current CPU usage. [0,100]: represents the current CPU usage.

item.name: System CPU usage threshold
item.description: Percent of CPU usage threshold. This value is in [0,100].

item.name: System disk partition usage threshold
item.description: Percent of hard disk partition usage threshold. This value is in [0,100].

item.name: System health
item.description: systemHealth information about system present state of health. This value will be one of the following: (1-OK, 2-Minor, 3-Major, 4-Critical)

trigger.name: systemHealth Critical
trigger.description: systemHealth information about system present state of health. This value will be one of the following: (1-OK, 2-Minor, 3-Major, 4-Critical)

trigger.name: systemHealth major
trigger.description: systemHealth information about system present state of health. This value will be one of the following: (1-OK, 2-Minor, 3-Major, 4-Critical)

trigger.name: systemHealth minor
trigger.description: systemHealth information about system present state of health.

item.name: System memory usage
item.description: Percent of memory usage. The value defined as: -1: invalid current memory usage. [0,100]: represents the current memory usage.

item.name: System memory usage threshold
item.description: Percent of memory usage threshold. This value is in [0,100].

item.name: System power state
item.description: System Power Status Get. 1 - Power Off 2 - Power On System Power Status Set. 1 - Normal Power Off 2 - Power On 3 - Forced System Reset 4 - Forced Power Cycle 5 - Forced Power Off The set actions are a process which will take effect in a while. When system in poweroff state, Power Off/Reset/PowerOffThenOn commonds are not supported.

item.name: Temperature entire status
item.description: Information about all temperature sensor health status.

item.name: Two factor authentication
item.description: The enable state of two-factor authentication. disable 1, enable 2. Default value is disable(1).

item.name: Two factor authentication revocation check
item.description: The enable state of certificate revocation check. disable 1, enable 2. Default value is disable(1).

item_prototype.name: Eth {#SNMPVALUE} host port
item_prototype.description: Information about share ethernet binded host port.

item_prototype.name: Eth {#SNMPVALUE} vlan ID
item_prototype.description: Disable or enable VLAN and set ID. Set 'off' to disabled VLAN. Set [1,4094] to enable VLAN and set ID.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} firmware state
item_prototype.description: Hard disk firmware state. 1: Unconfigured Good Can be set from Unconfigured Bad state, or JBOD state when raidControllerJBODEnable = Enabled. 2: Unconfigured Bad (read only) 3: Hot Spared (read only) 4: Offline Can be set from Online state. 5: Failed (read only) 6: Rebuild (read only) 7: Online Can be set from Offline state. 8: Copyback (read only) 9: JBOD Can be set from Unconfigured Good state when raidControllerJBODEnable = Enabled. 10: Unconfigured Shielded (read only) 11: Hot Spare Shielded (read only) 12: Configured Shielded (read only) 13: Foreign (read only) 14: Active (read only) 15: Stand-by (read only) 16: Sleep (read only) 17: DST executing in background (read only) 18: SMART Off-line Data Collection executing in background (read only) 19: SCT command executing in background (read only) 255: Unknown (read only)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} hot spare state
item_prototype.description: Hard disk hot spare state. 1: None Cancel the global/dedicated hot spare setting, can be set when hardDiskHotSpareState is Global/Dedicated. 2: Global Can be set only when hardDiskFwState = Unconfigured Good. 3: Dedicated Can be set only when hardDiskFwState = Unconfigured Good. Setting value described as following: Byte1 - Indicating the hard disk used as dedicated hot spare, fixed to 3. Byte2 - The logical drive index which the hard disk spared for, started from 1. For example: Set this hard disk as dedicated hot spare for logical drive 2, the setting value should be 0x0203 = 2 * 256 + 3 = 515. 4: Commissioned (read only) 5: Emergency (read only) 255: Unknown (read only)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} interface type
item_prototype.description: Hard disk interface type. SAS, SATA...etc. 1: Undefined 2: Parallel-SCSI 3: SAS 4: SATA 5: Fiber Channel 6: SATA/SAS 7: PCIe 255: Unknown

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} disk location state
item_prototype.description: Hard disk location state. 1: Unknown (read only) 2: Off 3: On

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} remnant wearout
item_prototype.description: "Hard disk remnant wearout (100% - 0). Only valid for SSD.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} input power
item_prototype.description: Information about input power. The unit is watt.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} add logical drive
item_prototype.description: Add logical drive on array on this RAID controller. The arguments are seperated by semicolons; The arguments format is <option1>=<argument>;<option2>=<argument>;...;<optionN>=<argument>; example: array=1;name=example;size=100.375g;ss=512k;rp=ra;wp=wb;iop=cio;ap=rw;dcp=enabled;init=quick; Options and arguments: array=<Array ID> The array on which the logical drive will be added. It is mandatory. name=<Logical drive name> The name of logical drive and maximum is 15 printable ASCII characters except ';'. It is optional. size=<Logical drive size> The size of logical drive and unit can be 'm'(megabytes),'g'(gigabytes), or 't'(terabytes). It is optional. ss=<Logical drive strip size> The strip size of logical drive. The valid values are 64k,128k,256k,512k,1M. It is optional. rp=<Read Policy> The read policy of logical drive. It is optional. ra: Read Ahead nra: No Read Ahead wp=<Write Policy> The write policy of logical drive. It is optional. wt: Write Through wbwithbbu: Write Back with BBU wb: Write Back iop=<IO Policy> The IO policy of logical drive. It is optional. cio: Cached IO dio: Direct IO ap=<Access Policy> The access policy of logical drive. It is optional. rw: Read Write ro: Read only blocked: Blocked dcp=<Disk Cache Policy> The disk cache policy of logical drive. It is optional. enabled: Enable disk cache disabled: Disable disk cache default: Unchanged(Disk's default) init=<Init Type> The initialization type of logical drive. It is optional. no: No init quick: Quick init full: Full init Note: Character ';' is not valid for logical drive name string because it is used as separator.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} BBU status
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller's BBU health status. bit0: 1 - voltage is low bit1: 1 - need replace pack bit2: 1 - learn cycle failed bit3: 1 - learn cycle timeout bit4: 1 - pack is about to fail bit5: 1 - remaining capacity low bit6: 1 - no space for cache offload others: reserved

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} BBU presence
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller's BBU presence. 1: Absent 2: Present 255: Unknown

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} BBU type
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller BBU type.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} cache pinned
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller if cache is pinned. 1: No 2: Yes 255: Unknown"

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} controller copy back
item_prototype.description: Information about the copyback state of RAID controller. 1: Unknown (read only) 2: Disabled 3: Enabled

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} create logical drive
item_prototype.description: Create new logical drive on this RAID controller. The arguments are seperated by semicolons; The arguments format is <option1>=<argument>;<option2>=<argument>;...;<optionN>=<argument>; example: rl=r1;pd=1,2;name=example;size=100.375g;ss=256k;sc=1;rp=ra;wp=wb;iop=cio;ap=rw;dcp=enabled;init=quick; or rl=r50;pd=1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9;name=example;size=500g;ss=1M;sc=3;rp=ra;wp=wb;iop=cio;ap=rw;dcp=enabled;init=quick; Options and arguments: rl=<RAID level> The RAID level of logical drive. It is mandatory. When 'cachecade=1' is specified, RAID level 0/1 is valid. r0: RAID0 r1: RAID1 r5: RAID5 r6: RAID6 r10: RAID10 r50: RAID50 r60: RAID60 pd=<PD IDs> The physical drives IDs which participate this logical drive. It is mandatory. name=<Logical drive name> The name of logical drive. The maximum is 15 printable ASCII characters except ';'. It is optional. size=<Logical drive size> The size of logical drive and unit can be 'm'(megabytes),'g'(gigabytes), or 't'(terabytes). It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. ss=<Logical drive strip size> The strip size of logical drive. The valid values are 64k,128k,256k,512k,1M. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. sc=<Span count> The span count of logical drive. The default is 1 when RAID level is RAID0/1/5/6 and 2 when RAID level is RAID10/50/60. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. rp=<Read Policy> The read policy of logical drive. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. ra: Read Ahead nra: No Read Ahead wp=<Write Policy> The write policy of logical drive. It is optional. wt: Write Through wbwithbbu: Write Back with BBU wb: Write Back iop=<IO Policy> The IO policy of logical drive. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. cio: Cached IO dio: Direct IO ap=<Access Policy> The access policy of logical drive. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. rw: Read Write ro: Read only blocked: Blocked dcp=<Disk Cache Policy> The disk cache policy of logical drive. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. enabled: Enable disk cache disabled: Disable disk cache default: Unchanged(Disk's default) init=<Init Type> The initialization type of logical drive. It is optional and not necessary when 'cachecade=1' is specified. no: No init quick: Quick init full: Full init cachecade=1 Logical drive is used for secondary cache. It is optional. It must be supported by RAID controller first. Note: Character ';' is not valid for logical drive name string because it is used as separator.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} DDR ECC count
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller DDR ECC count.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} interface type
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller device interface type. 1: SPI 2: SAS-3G 3: SATA-1.5G 4: SATA-3G 5: SAS-6G 6: SAS-12G 255: Unknown

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} driver name
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller driver name.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} driver version
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller driver version.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} firmware version
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller firmware version.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} status
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller health status. bit0: 1- memory correctable error bit1: 1- memory uncorrectable error bit2: 1- memory ECC error reached limit bit3: 1- NVRAM uncorrectable error other: reserved

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} JBOD
item_prototype.description: Information about the JBOD state of RAID controller. 1: Unknown (read only) 2: Disabled 3: Enabled

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} PD fail history
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller if maintain PD fail history. 1: No 2: Yes 255: Unknown

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} maxsimum strip support bytes
item_prototype.description: Information about the maximum strip size that RAID controller support.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} memory size
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller memory size (MB).

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} minimum strip support bytes
item_prototype.description: Information about the minimum strip size that RAID controller support.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} mode
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller mode. 1: None-RAID 2: RAID 255: Unknown

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} NVData version
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller NVData version.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} settings
item_prototype.description: Restore RAID controller settings (write only). The argument is: 1: Restore RAID controller settings. others: invalid

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} SAS address
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller SAS address.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} smart copy back
item_prototype.description: Information about the copyback state on SMART error of RAID controller. 1: Unknown (read only) 2: Disabled 3: Enabled Note: Set action is available only when raidControllerCopybackEnable = Enabled.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} OOB management
item_prototype.description: Information about RAID controller if support OOB management. 1: No 2: Yes

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} syslog receiver IP addrsss
item_prototype.description: Syslog Receiver IP addrsss. Default value is empty.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} syslog receiver test
item_prototype.description: Test the syslog. When set, the value is only 1

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE} syslog send log type
item_prototype.description: The log type of syslog send. Support set/get any combination of the 3 log type(OperationLogs,SecurityLogs,EventLogs), use comma to separate them. none/all is also supported,but never use it with the 3 log types together. e.g. To set OperationLogs + SecurityLogs log type message, just set: OperationLogs,SecurityLogs To set EventLogs message, just set: EventLogs To set none level message, just set: none To set all level message, just set: all

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} lower critical
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature lower critical threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} lower minor
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature lower minor threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} lower nonrecoverable
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature lower nonrecoverable threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} temperature
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature reading,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree. If power off, the CPU temperature cannot be readable and is set to 65535.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} upper critical
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature upper critical threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} upper minor
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature upper minor threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVICENAME} upper nonrecoverable
item_prototype.description: Information about temperature upper nonrecoverable threshold,the unit is 1/10 Celsius degree,65535 represent NA.
